title: Post-Authoritarian Norms and the Ideological Legacy of Dictatorships
descriptions: This grant proposal seeks funding for a research project titled "Post-Authoritarian Norms and the Ideological Legacy of Dictatorships." The project aims to explore the impact of ideological associations with past authoritarian regimes on political norms in new democracies. By focusing on countries like Poland, Portugal, and Eastern Europe, the study will use survey experiments to investigate how these associations shape political positions for voters and parties. The theoretical contributions of this research include the development of a new theory on the rejection of the ideological brand of past authoritarian regimes. The expected outputs include a new theory explaining political competition heterogeneity across new democracies. The inquiry will specifically focus on issues such as the decline of left-wing parties in Poland, the delayed emergence of radical right parties in Portugal, and the higher likelihood of right-wing protests in Eastern Europe. By investigating voters' avoidance of past dictatorship ideologies and their impact on party competition, this project aims to shed light on citizens' ideological preferences, perceptions of party stances, national identity, political discussions, and the supply of new parties in post-transition democracies.
